cumulated.origin: |- wb(wcel(c0, cdm(citg1)), wa(wcel(c0, cmbf), w3a(wf(c0, cr, cr), wcel(crn(c0), cfn), wcel(cfv(cvol, cima(ccnv(c0), cdif(cr, csn(nat0)))), cr))))

comment: The predicate " ` F ` is a simple function". A simple function is a finite nonnegative linear combination of indicator functions for finitely measurable sets. We use the idiom ` F e. dom S.1 ` to represent this concept because ` S.1 ` is the first preparation function for our final definition ` S. ` (see ~ df-itg ); unlike that operator, which can integrate any function, this operator can only integrate simple functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jun-2014.)
